learning_objective: Incorporate existing code, media, and libraries into original programs, and give attribution.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is developing a website to help their younger sister, who's a junior in high school, navigate the college application process. Alex wants to include an interactive map where you can click on a college and get information about it. Alex found a useful open-source map code on Github. What should Alex do in order to ethically use this code in their website?",
    "Answer1": "Download the code, modify it for their needs, and use it in their website without any mention of the original Github code.",
    "Answer2": "Download the code, modify it for their needs, and use it in their website with proper attribution to the original Github code.",
    "Answer3": "Take a screenshot of the map display from the Github page, then use that screenshot on their website as the interactive map.",
    "Answer4": "Download the code, modify it to include some errors, and then use it in their website without any mention of the original Github code.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "When incorporating existing code into a new project, it's important to give credit to the original source, especially if the code is open-source and requires that any re-use includes attribution. This is an ethical responsibility and often a legal one."
}
